title: Taiwan's new President Lai Ching-te faces stormy years ahead
summary: The Democratic Progressive Party candidate, reviled by Beijing for his past comments on independence, won the January 13 presidential election, on the island which Beijing pledges to reunify with mainland China.

title: Ferocious winter weather in the US: closed highways, flooding, Republican campaign events canceled
summary: As the three-day Martin Luther King Jr. Day weekend began, the weather forecast was a quilt of color-coded advisories, from an ice storm warning in Oregon to a blizzard warning in the northern Plains to high wind warnings in New Mexico.

title: In the Comoros, President Azali Assoumani is the favorite in an already disputed election
summary: On Sunday, the 65-year-old former putschist will run for a third consecutive term. Opponents are already condemning numerous irregularities.

title: AFCON 2024: Host Côte d'Ivoire wins opening match against Guinea-Bissau
summary: Seko Fofana's stunning early goal set Côte d'Ivoire on the way to a 2-0 win over Guinea-Bissau before a euphoric crowd as the Africa Cup of Nations kicked off on Saturday.

title: Saudi Arabia attempts to position itself as mediator after US-British strikes against Houthis in Yemen
summary: Riyadh wants to stay out of the conflict pitting Yemeni rebels against Israel and its American ally. The kingdom fears it could jeopardize the peace initiated with the Houthis after nine years of war in Yemen.

title: From a 'ludicrously capacious' bag to fake sausages: 'Succession' props sell for a fortune
summary: An online auction in Dallas, ending Saturday, brought in a total of $627,825 for 236 lots of items sold from the set of the HBO drama expected to also clean up at Monday's Emmy Awards after its Golden Globes wins.

title: After a decent 2023, the French tourism sector has its hopes set on the Paris Olympics
summary: The sector has returned to the levels seen before the Covid-19 pandemic, but it still suffers from certain weaknesses.

title: Accused of genocide before the International Court of Justice, Israel pleads a war of 'necessity'
summary: South Africa asked the court to order the suspension of the Israeli military operation in Gaza.

title: Breivik continues to haunt Norway, 12 years after committing one of its worst massacres
summary: Sentenced to the maximum penalty in 2012, the perpetrator of the attacks of July 22, 2011, which caused the deaths of 77 people, is asking for a relaxation of his detention conditions. But the intelligence services are against it.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'European rules have played a major role in exacerbating tax dumping'
summary: In the wake of former Commission President Jacques Delors' death, and ahead of the European elections in June, the French economist looks back at the history of European integration.

title: Paris 2024: Amélie Oudéa-Castéra – superminister, but with what powers?
summary: Expanding the Sports and Olympic Games Minister's role to include national education and youth raises doubts about her ability to manage two major government priorities effectively, particularly with only six months until the opening ceremony.

title: French sneaker brand Veja expands production in Portugal
summary: After having had its shoes manufactured exclusively in Brazil since its creation in 2004, the company produced 100,000 of its 3.5 million pairs in Portugal in 2023. It now intends to expand into Portugal, a country with a strong position in this sector.

title: AFCON 2024: Egyptian and South African footballers, legends on their own turf
summary: Wages, weather, popularity: It's hard for European clubs to lure players from Cairo and Johannesburg, who enjoy excellent conditions at their local clubs and some of the most competitive leagues on the continent.

title: Former New Zealand PM Ardern marries after engagement prolonged by pandemic
summary: Jacinda Ardere had originally planned to marry longtime partner Clarke Gayford in 2022 but postponed the wedding due to Covid-19 restrictions.

title: Ukrainian lawmakers call on the government to review its mobilization bill
summary: The country, engaged in war for nearly two years, is facing a shortage of new recruits and is finding it challenging to establish new recruitment rules.

title: Italy blocks extradition of priest accused of murder and torture in Argentina
summary: Franco Reverberi fled Argentina in 2012 after he was charged with being part of a group that 'illegally kidnapped political opponents, taking them to a secret place where they were tortured and one of them died.'

title: Hsiao Bi-khim: Taiwan's vice-presidential candidate, friend of the United States and adversary of China
summary: The vice-presidential candidate from the Democratic Progressive Party, running with Lai Ching-te in the January 13 election, served as Taiwan's representative in Washington until the end of November. She has also been on Beijing's blacklist since 2022.

title: Trump ordered to pay New York Times and three journalists $400,000 in legal fees
summary: The former US president had sued the newspaper unsuccessfully over a Pulitzer Prize-winning 2018 story about his family's wealth and tax practices.

title: 41 prison workers freed in Ecuador, 133 still held hostage
summary: The guards and prison workers were taken hostage after President Daniel Noboa announced on Monday a military takedown of criminal groups, sparking a deadly confrontation with narco gangs.

title: John Kerry, the US climate envoy, to leave the Biden administration
summary: Kerry was one of the leading drafters of the 2015 Paris climate accords. He represented Massachusetts for 28 years in the Senate and was also the Democratic presidential nominee in 2004.

title: Ukraine's defense industry struggles to build momentum
summary: Two years after the start of the Russian invasion, despite some technological achievements, defense companies are still lagging.

title: Prince Frederik to be crowned king of Denmark
summary: After a 52-year reign, Queen Margrethe II hands over her crown to her eldest son on January 14. The future Frederik X has won the hearts of Danes, who had long been skeptical of his ability to represent the monarchy.
